alert.note: Alert for Hatteras Island; Northern Outer Banks; Ocracoke Island (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Watch issued January 07 at 3:04PM EST until January 10 at 3:00PM EST by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...2 to 4 feet of inundation above ground level possible in low- lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. * WHERE...Areas along the beaches, Albemarle, Croatan, and Roanoke Sounds, Kitty Hawk Bay, Pamlico Sound, and adjacent tidal creeks, and Ocracoke Island. * WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon through Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...2 to 4 feet of inundation above ground level is possible in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways resulting in a threat of property damage. Some roads and low lying property including parking lots, parks, lawns, and homes adjacent to the waterfront will experience shallow flooding. Moderate to significant ocean overwash is likely, mainly from Oregon Inlet to Ocracoke. This could impact portions of Highway 12, especially during times of high tide. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Both soundside and oceanside flooding is expected Tuesday into Wednesday, with the potential for rapid water rises Tuesday night into Wednesday. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Oregon Inlet NC MLLW Categories - Minor 3.0 ft, Moderate 4.5 ft, Major 5.5 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 2.4 ft, Moderate 3.9 ft, Major 4.9 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 07/04 PM 1.9 1.3 1.7 2 None 08/04 AM 1.9 1.3 1.5 2 None 08/05 PM 1.4 0.8 1.1 1 None 09/05 AM 1.8 1.2 1.3 1-2 None 10/06 AM 3.6 3.0 3.1 3 Minor &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
